items.author: Todd McCarthy
items.content: The Usual Suspects is an ironic, bang-up thriller about the wages of crime. A terrific cast of exciting actors socks over this absorbingly complicated yarn that's been spun in a seductively slick fashion by director Bryan Singer.

items.author: Newsweek
items.content: This one's done right. Here's an intelligent movie with no special effects. You have to pay close attention, to listen hard to its cross-fires of dialogue.

items.author: Ann Hornaday
items.content: Dense, ironic and thoroughly engrossing caper melodrama.

items.author: James Berardinelli
items.content: The Usual Suspects is an accomplished synthesis of noir elements and, as such, is an entertaining entry to the genre.

items.author: F. X. Feeney
items.content: Byrne is a stand-up poet the way some actors are stand-up comics. His innate depth prompts The Usual Suspects to transcend its own cleverness--and this is the movie's smartest, least predictable surprise.
This thriller is like a game of life-and-death chess, with quick double-crosses and wild gambits.
I liked this film better the second time around.

items.author: Lisa Schwarzbaum
items.content: Dense with plot intricacies, thick with atmosphere, and packed with showy roles for a hip ensemble.

items.author: Roger Ebert
items.content: To the degree that you will want to see this movie, it will be because of the surprise, and so I will say no more, except to say that the "solution," when it comes, solves little - unless there is really little to solve, which is also a possibility.
